name: Holiday Inn Express Suites Belmont

reviews.text: This HI had the best rate of any good hotel in proximity of SFO. The location is super easy to find, close to good diners and shopping. Also, 15 minutes and you are at SFO. The facilty is super-clean and nice, internet speedy, no problem with parking in own underground garrage and the room was really quiet too, despite facing the main road. Highly recommended! It's an Express facility, with free hot breakfast, which was really nice.
reviews.title: Hidden gem, close to Airport and Silicon Valley

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had traveled to the Fresno, CA area for a quick visit to a friend, so my wife and I decided to make it weekend trip to San Francisco due to its close proximity. We decided to stay outside of San Francisco itself to avoid all the traffic congestion and hassle of having to pay for parking. We arrived on a Friday night and we were quickly checked in. We got to the room and it was clean and comfy for the two of us. We checked out the bathroom and it was pretty good. We stayed a total of two nights and had an overall pleasant stay. The bed was ok, but not as comfortable as other Holiday Inn Express we have stayed at before. The room had a dual air conditioner/heater window unit (typical in most hotels). We did not have any issues with this at all. The bathroom door was a bit annoying in that it would not stay open. It would always close as if it was not level. This was not a big issue though. The morning breakfast was pretty good. Scrambled eggs, all sorts of breads/pastries, cereal, yogurts, etc. And it was included in our room rate! Most other hotels charged additional for this. Parking was also free (plenty of it available). Other reviews indicated that there were no places to eat, but I would have to differ. There was a mall not too far from the hotel (about 2.5 miles) that provided plenty of places to eat (unless you wanted to just walk a block or two). In this case, there is a subway and a couple of restaurants within walking distance. We truly enjoyed our stay. I would recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: San Francisco weekend trip

reviews.text: The guys that work here are super nice and helpful. They really go the extra mile. The room is average, but completely serviceable. The location is pretty poor. There is nothing around other than a Subway and a pizza shop that sells uncooked pizzas. You can walk to the Caltrain, but it's a fair stretch. The breakfast is really poor. I daren't touch the luminous products in the hot cupboard so just had a banana.

reviews.text: We used this hotel as a base for our 3 day stay in San Francisco. The downtown is half an hour away, and the hotel is located couple of minutes away from US 101. The advantages of having free parking, clean and comfortable room, nice hot breakfast outweighed the factor of having to commute to the city. We really enjoyed our stay here!
reviews.title: Great option near San Francisco

reviews.text: I have become a fan of Holiday Inn Express for their rooms, amenities and service. This has been one of the best. Comfortable, clean, efficient and helpful staff, and everything worked as expected - great a/c, tv. refrigerator, microwave, hot water,etc. And underground free parking.
reviews.title: Pleasant and reasonable hotel in Belmont

reviews.text: I have stayed here 2-3 times before. It is super great location. Easy to get on/off the 101. Close to lots of offices. Right on El Camino.

reviews.text: I was very tired after a long week of business traveling and this was my last night on the road. When I checked in I discovered I must have left my credit card at the resturant that I had eaten the previous evening. The hotel clerk inquired which resturant and he recognized it and without asking he looked up the phone number, called and handed me the phone and I was able to find and get my credit card back. The room is very nice. Extremely clean. Great hotel, great staff and great value. I will put this in my top hotels to stay when in this area!!

reviews.text: Check-in was fast and friendly. Large clean spacious rooms, comfortable bed, flat screen TV, free wifi, nice breakfast in the morning. Bathroom is large and very clean. Public bus stops are located next to and across the street from hotel. You can get to the hotel by public transit, take Samtrans KX towards Palo Alto, trip to hotel in Belmont abut 25 minutes, take KX in reverse to get back to the airport, or you can take this bus to San Bruno for a connection to BART into San Francisco.

description: Welcome to beautiful Belmont/Mt. Holly, NC. Our 92 new rooms & suites are just the thing you are looking for. Located just minutes from Charlotte (CLT), NC & three miles from the U.S. National Whitewater Center. We are in the perfect location to meet all your needs. This hotel is unique among area hotels, for its comfort, luxury and convenience. Enjoy our Express Start breakfast with a delicious selection of eggs, bacon, biscuits, gravy, pastries, fruits, breads, cereals, juices, and muffins. All of our beautiful rooms feature 32' LCD televisions, complimentary high-speed wireless Internet access, microwave, refrigerator, in-room safes, pillow top mattress, iron & board, alarm clock, two phones with data ports, voicemail, and brand-new furnishings sure to please. Our goal is to provide you with excellent service, so stop in and Stay Smart at the Holiday Inn Express & Suites Charlotte Airport Belmont.
